Git.jl

  • Readme
  • Docstrings
    • Docstrings
    Docstrings
    Git.GITHUB_REGEX
    Git.Git
    Git.State
    Git.attached — Function.
    Git.attached(; dir="")

    Determine whether HEAD is attached to a commit in the given respository.

    Git.branch — Function.
    Git.branch(; dir="")

    Return the name of the current active branch in the given repository.

    Git.cmd — Function.
    Git.cmd(args; dir="")

    Return a Git command from the given arguments, acting on the repository given in dir.

    Git.depsjl
    Git.different — Function.
    Git.different(verA, verB, path; dir="")

    Determine whether two trees are different with respect to the given path.

    Git.dir — Function.
    Git.dir(d)

    Return the path to the default .git for the given repository directory, or the path to use in place of the default .git.

    Git.dirty — Function.
    Git.dirty([paths]; dir="")

    Determine whether the paths in the given repository are dirty, i.e. contain modified but uncommitted tracked files.

    Git.eval
    Git.git — Function.
    Git.git([d])

    Return a Git command that refers to the work tree and directory given by d, or the current work tree and directory if d is not specified.

    Git.gitcmd
    Git.head — Function.
    Git.head(; dir="")

    Return the commit to which HEAD currently refers.

    Git.include
    Git.is_ancestor_of — Function.
    Git.is_ancestor_of(a, b; dir="")

    Determine whether the commit a is an ancestor of the commit b in the given repository.

    Git.iscommit — Function.
    Git.iscommit(name; dir="")

    Determine whether name refers to a commit in the repository dir. name can be a single SHA1 or a vector of SHA1s.

    Git.modules — Function.
    Git.modules(args; dir="")

    Apply the Git command with the given arguments on the given repository to the configuration file .gitmodules and read the result as a string.

    Git.normalize_url — Function.
    Git.normalize_url(url)

    Normalize the given URL to a valid GitHub repository URL.

    Git.readchomp — Function.
    Git.readchomp(args; dir="")

    Read the result of the Git command using the given arguments on the given repository as a string, removing a single trailing newline if present.

    Git.readstring — Function.
    Git.readstring(args; dir="")

    Read the result of the Git command using the given arguments on the given repository as a string.

    Git.restore — Function.
    Git.restore(s::State; dir="")

    Restore the given repository to the state s.

    Git.run — Function.
    Git.run(args; dir="", out=stdout)

    Execute the Git command from the given arguments args on the repository dir, writing the results to the output stream out.

    Git.set_remote_url — Function.
    Git.set_remote_url(url; remote="origin", dir="")

    Add a remote remote to the given repository from the URL url.

    Git.snapshot — Function.
    Git.snapshot(; dir="")

    Return a State object that captures a snapshot of the given repository.

    Git.staged — Function.
    Git.staged([paths]; dir="")

    Determine whether the paths in the given repository contain staged files.

    Git.success — Function.
    Git.success(args; dir="")

    Determine whether the Git command using the given arguments on the given repository executed successfully.

    Git.transact — Function.
    Git.transact(f; dir="")

    Attempt to execute the function f. If this fails, the repository is restored to its state prior to execution.

    Git.unstaged — Function.
    Git.unstaged([paths]; dir="")

    Determine whether the paths in the given repository contain unstaged files.

    Git.version — Function.
    Git.version()

    Return the version of Git being used by the package.
